data.title: Leo's, No lion here just good eats.
data.text:
Nice place, cheap and plentiful, breakfast special when were were there.
Nice dinner menu also. Waitress very friendly. Good food, nice atmosphere.
Parking in the rear unless you find a spot on the street. Stop in for dinner after a movie.

data.title: Late Night Dining
data.text: Whether you're looking for a quick lunch or some light fare to linger over after taking in a movie, Leo's is a good location in downtown Royal Oak. Within walking distance of many of the shops and theatres, Leo's offers good food, including Detroit Coney Dogs, Greek Lemon Rice Soup and a variety of fruit pies. What else matters?

data.title: You Can't Go Wrong With Leo's
data.text: Love this place. Three of us went on a cold, windy January day in Michigan. Delicious food, nice atmosphere- felt at home. Red Wings game was on the big screen. Even though the waitress was new and it was the end of her shift she did a good job. If you're looking for a good diner experience you can't go wrong with Leo's.

data.title: Tonite was the last time I entered Leos in Royal Oak.
data.text:
About a month ago I took advantage of a breakfast special but as usual the hook was the two dollar cup of coffee and having to start a small fire (well almost) to get a refill from the club of chatty Kathies they have for morning waitstaff.
Perhaps they should provide flareguns to customers.
Then there was the time I ordered fish and chips and was told later they do not have coleslaw, followed a wee later with a sundae covered with colored sprinkles instead of whipped cream and cherry as pictured. Two weeks later I asked before I ordered if they had coleslaw and they said no, yet it is described as having it on the menu.
But tonite really took the take. The club sandwich that I was sharing with a friend was not only dry and made with scorched bread and tough bacon it also contained a surprise. My friend made a face and produced an inch of tooth pick from the sandwich, but the mystery was that the four tooth picks used to hold the sandwich were intact. Luckily he had not swallowed it. Instead of the manager coming over as requested we were told by the waitress they would take off a dollar. After another complaint about how unprofessional this was, and how dangerous the situation could have been the very young acting manager finally after more than a few minutes of waiting said she would not charge us. I left a three dollar tip for the waitress, it is not her fault the food is crap.  
Royal Oak has gone way down. We just left the pig sty that is Blaze Pizza to go to Leos and this is what we get? Caveat emptor when it comes to absentee ownership in any restaurant or pizzeria. Make sure your medical insurance is paid up before eating at Leos anywhere if this is how they run the place. PS I never get a straight answer on what kind of fish is used in the Fish and Chips. I will not order it anymore. I was at a Leos on 13 mile where they at least had coleslaw but the fish tasted like catfish, not cod or Pollack that you expect minimally when you order fish and chips. No more, from now on I get by breaded North (not Pacific) codfish from Trader Joes and make my own.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Once we are done walking at the zoo we go and enjoy a nice salad or omelet at Leo's.  It is always busy and the food is delicious.  The waitresses are always friendly and swift.

data.title: Convenient downtown location
data.text:
I noticed that several reviewers seemed hip to Leo’s Coney Island over Athens Coney Island, so we tried Leo’s for lunch.  The burger with chili was quite good but we like the fries at Athens better.  To date, the best fries we’ve eaten lately came from Tom’s Oyster Bar.  

Leo’s is a nice downtown Royal Oak option for a Coney or Greek cuisine if you don’t feel like venturing over to Athens or down to National on 12 Mile.  We used to be devotees of the vintage-look National Coney on 12 Mile but the quality started to slip.  

There’s no reason to not go to Leo’s but I think we’ll head back to Athens Coney on Woodward the next time we want a Coney.

data.title: Always open
data.text: I have easily spent way too much time here, but only one did I get something that wasn't made to my expectations and they replaced it no questions asked.  Love the hash browns, greek salads, chocolate shakes especially after a night of hard drinking.  I am always shocked at how cheap my bill is when I feel like I've ordered the whole menu.

data.title: Breakfast was REALLY GOOD!
data.text: Breakfast is easy, I know, but when you have a great breakfast it's nice to share - I had bacon, eggs, biscuits and gravy and everything was hot, fresh, tasty and came out quick. Prices were good too.

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: One of the best coney islands in Detroit.  It's  open 24 hours a day.  More than just a coney island,; great breakfast and diner entrées.

data.title: Great breakfast spot!
data.text: In my opinion and having worked at a Coney Island in my teens, I must say Leo's is a name to watch. The food here is always wonderful and the service can't be beat. Even when they're busy, you get good service. Oh, make sure you try an omelette, any omelette! I love doing breakfast here!

data.title: Great coney food
data.text: I love Leo's!  I always grab their Greek salad and I just love it!  I also get the spinach pie and it is the best around!  I have tried it at other coney's and it was a greasy mess but Leo's has the perfect pie!  The service is always fast and great, with very friendly staff!  Great place for a quick meal with the family or friends!

data.title: Great Dining Option for Everyday Meal
data.text: I ate there few times in the past and never had a bad meal. Stopped there today for dinner. Had a small greek salad with chicken (comes with pita).It was delicious. Outstanding greek dressing.Place was clean. Atmosphere was nice. Service was good. Prices are reasonable. In the past I had breakfast there and it was really good. They also got good chicken kebob, opa. One of the best hot dogs/coney dogs. Great menu selection.
